1.text: Welcome to pathfinder. This tutorial will show you how to use this application in order to better understand pathfinding algorithms. Please feel free to skip ahead. Enjoy!

2.text: Chose algorithm on the top-left corner and click Start to run it. Purple field means that the program has already visited that space and yellow field means path from start node to end node.

3.text: Hold left mouse button on start, end or target node and drag to move a node.

4.text: Create walls by clicking or draging on empty space using the left mouse button. Delete walls by doing alike on nodes that are currently walls. The algorithm cannot get through the walls.

5.text: Weights are created the same way as walls, but the weight option must be actived. Majority of algorithms find it harder to go through weighted space rather than empty. For instance, 10 weight is equivalent to 10 empty spaces.

6.text: Click on the TARGET option to create the target element. If the target exist, then algorithm will try to find it first and after that, the end node.
